konfound 0.2.1

Infrastructure of konfound package

konfound – for users’ own data, depending on the object you use,

  • linear regression (lm object)
  • logistic regression (glm object, with logistic as a specification)
  • table object
  • other objects (give a message that not applicable for now)

pkonfound – for published study – rely on the published study, may not know all detail

  • linear regression
  • logistic regression
  • a table – should allow users to choose whatever methods (chi-square or fisher)

mkonfound – meta analysis (edited)

Features in-development

There is an in-development non-linear option:

pkonfound(-0.2, 0.103, 20888, 3, n_trm = 17888, non_linear = TRUE)

A related function tkonfound() can take a 2 x 2 table of treatment versus control cases and success versus failure for the outcome, i.e.:

tkonfound(35, 17, 17, 38)

You can also draw figures for change in effect size as a function of switching outcomes.

tkonfound_fig(35, 17, 17, 38)
